35 void prl::wienerFilter(cv::Mat& inputImage, cv::Mat& outputImage,
36  int filterKernelWidth, int filterKernelHeight,
37  double coeffWiener, double sigmaGauss)
38 {
39  if (inputImage.empty())
40  {
41  throw std::invalid_argument("Input image for deblurring is empty");
42  }
43 
44  if (!((filterKernelWidth > 1) && (filterKernelHeight > 1)))
45  {
46  throw std::invalid_argument("Parameters must satisfy the following condition: \
47  ( (filterKernelWidth > 1) && (filterKernelHeight > 1) ) ");
48  }
49 
50  if (sigmaGauss <= 0)
51  {
52  throw std::invalid_argument("Parameters must satisfy the following condition: \
53  ( sigmaGauss > 0 ) ");
54  }
55 
56  int inputImageHeight = inputImage.rows;
57  int inputImageWidth = inputImage.cols;
58 
59 
61 
62  cv::Mat kernelImage = cv::Mat(filterKernelHeight, filterKernelWidth, CV_64FC1);
63 
64  double sigmaSqr = sigmaGauss * sigmaGauss;
65 
66  double amplitude = 1 / (sigmaGauss * std::sqrt(2 * CV_PI));
67 
68  int halfFilterKernelWidth = filterKernelWidth / 2;
69  int halfFilterKernelHeight = filterKernelHeight / 2;
70 
71  for (int i = 0; i < filterKernelHeight; ++i)
72  {
73  int y = i - halfFilterKernelHeight;
74  const double ySqr = y * y;
75 
76  for (int j = 0; j < filterKernelWidth; ++j)
77  {
78  int x = j - halfFilterKernelWidth;
79  double xSqr = x * x;
80 
81  double exponent = static_cast<double>((ySqr + xSqr) / (2.0 * sigmaSqr));
82 
83  kernelImage.at<double>(i, j) = amplitude * exp(-exponent);
84  }
85  }
86 
88 
89  cv::Mat kernelMatrix = cv::Mat::zeros(inputImageHeight, inputImageWidth, CV_64FC1);
90 
91  {
92  double sumKernelElements = 0.0;
93 
94  int inputImageWidthHalf = inputImageWidth / 2;
95  int inputImageHeightHalf = inputImageHeight / 2;
96 
97  /*std::shared_ptr<double[]> kernelTempMatrix(
98  new double[inputImageWidth * inputImageWidth], std::default_delete<double[]>());*/
99 
100  std::vector<double> kernelTempMatrix(inputImageWidth * inputImageWidth);
101 
102  for (int y = 0; y < inputImageHeight; ++y)
103  {
104  for (int x = 0; x < inputImageWidth; ++x)
105  {
106  int index = y * inputImageWidth + x;
107  double value = 0.0;
108 
109  // if we are in the kernel area (of small kernelImage), then take pixel values.
110  // Otherwise keep 0
111  if (std::abs(x - inputImageWidthHalf) < (filterKernelWidth - 2) / 2 &&
112  std::abs(y - inputImageHeightHalf) < (filterKernelHeight - 2) / 2)
113  {
114  int xLocal = x - (inputImageWidth - filterKernelWidth) / 2;
115  int yLocal = y - (inputImageHeight - filterKernelHeight) / 2;
116 
117  value = kernelImage.at<double>(yLocal, xLocal);
118  }
119 
120  kernelTempMatrix[index] = value;
121  sumKernelElements += std::abs(value);
122  }
123  }
124 
125  // Zero-protection
126  if (sumKernelElements == 0.0)
127  {
128  sumKernelElements = 1.0;
129  }
130 
131  // Normalize
132  double sumKernelElementsBack = 1.0 / sumKernelElements;
133  for (int i = 0; i < inputImageWidth * inputImageHeight; ++i)
134  {
135  kernelTempMatrix[i] *= sumKernelElementsBack;
136  }
137 
138  // Translate kernel, because we don't use centered FFT
139  // (by multiply input image on pow(-1, x + y))
140  // so we need to translate kernel by (width / 2) to the left
141  // and by (height / 2) to the up
142  for (size_t y = 0; y < inputImageHeight; ++y)
143  {
144  for (size_t x = 0; x < inputImageWidth; ++x)
145  {
146  int xTranslated = (x + inputImageWidth / 2) % inputImageWidth;
147  int yTranslated = (y + inputImageHeight / 2) % inputImageHeight;
148  (reinterpret_cast<double*>(kernelMatrix.data))[y * inputImageWidth + x] =
149  kernelTempMatrix[yTranslated * inputImageWidth + xTranslated];
150 
151 // kernelMatrix.at<double>(y, x) =
152 // kernelTempMatrix.get()[yTranslated * inputImageWidth + xTranslated];
153  }
154  }
155 
156  }
157 
158  cv::Mat kernelFFT;
159  cv::dft(kernelMatrix, kernelFFT, cv::DFT_COMPLEX_OUTPUT);
160 
162  for (int y = 0; y < inputImageHeight; ++y)
163  {
164  for (int x = 0; x < inputImageWidth; ++x)
165  {
166  double pointValueReal = kernelFFT.at<std::complex<double> >(y, x).real();
167  double pointValueImag = kernelFFT.at<std::complex<double> >(y, x).imag();
168 
169  double pointValueRealSqr = pointValueReal * pointValueReal;
170  double pointValueImagSqr = pointValueImag * pointValueImag;
171 
172  double energyValue = pointValueRealSqr + pointValueImagSqr;
173 
174  double wienerValue = pointValueReal / (energyValue + coeffWiener);
175 
176  kernelFFT.at<std::complex<double> >(y, x) *= wienerValue;
177  }
178  }
179 
181 
182 
183  std::vector<cv::Mat> inputImageChannels, resultImageChannels;
184  cv::split(inputImage, inputImageChannels);
185 
186  for (cv::Mat& inputChannel : inputImageChannels)
187  {
188  cv::Mat realTypeInputChannel;
189  inputChannel.convertTo(realTypeInputChannel, CV_64F);
190 
191  cv::Mat inputChannelFFT = cv::Mat::zeros(realTypeInputChannel.size(), realTypeInputChannel.type());
192  cv::dft(realTypeInputChannel, inputChannelFFT, cv::DFT_COMPLEX_OUTPUT);
193 
194  //inputChannelFFT *= 1.0 / (inputImageWidth * inputImageHeight);
195 
196  cv::Mat outputChannelFFT;
197  cv::mulSpectrums(inputChannelFFT, kernelFFT, outputChannelFFT, 0);
198 
199  cv::Mat complexTypeResultChannel;
200  cv::idft(outputChannelFFT, complexTypeResultChannel, cv::DFT_SCALE);
201 
202  std::vector<cv::Mat> resultRealTypeSubchannels;
203  cv::split(complexTypeResultChannel, resultRealTypeSubchannels);
204 
205  resultRealTypeSubchannels[0].convertTo(resultRealTypeSubchannels[0], CV_8UC1);
206  resultImageChannels.push_back(resultRealTypeSubchannels[0]);
207  }
208 
209  cv::merge(resultImageChannels, outputImage);
210 }
